content: A `Listbox` displays a list of options. It supports static items defined in JSX (`ListboxItem`) and dynamic items from an external data source passed to the `items` prop.
Listbox supports `single` or `multiple` selection modes. Use `onAction` to handle item activation and `onSelectionChange` for selection.
Items can have `startContent`/`endContent` (for icons) and a `description`. You can group items with `ListboxSection` and add `topContent` or `bottomContent` to the list.
For long lists, virtualization can be enabled with the `isVirtualized` prop for improved performance.
Key stylable slots for `Listbox` are `base` and `list`. For `ListboxItem`, slots include `base`, `title`, `description`, and `selectedIcon`.
The Listbox is fully accessible with keyboard navigation (Arrow keys, Home/End, typeahead) and ARIA roles.
